boardgame.name: Star Wars PocketModel TCG
Star Wars PocketModels
SWPM
boardgame.description:
From the press release:

"The Star Wars PocketModel TCG combines the best features of classic TCGs with those of "constructible strategy games" (CSGs), a category that WizKids pioneered. This TCG innovation allows players to use characters and action scenes from the movies on their cards to help control their fleets of PocketModel ships as they attempt to destroy each other’s objectives. This exciting, easy-to-learn game derives its content from all six Star Wars movies, making it possible for fans of all generations to enjoy battling for control of the galaxy!"

The pieces of the model are punched out from pre-painted plastic cards, and snapped together with interlocking tabs. Stats for each model are summarized on the base. Each pack came with a set of cards that were used to enhance the models. Each pack also came with a play mat that summarized the rules and provided the play area.

To play the full game, each player needed a thirty card deck, and thirty build stars worth of models. Each model has one, two or three (or more) small stars on the rear of the base. This is the cost of the model. The more rare the model, or how large it is, the more build stars it costs.

Related to:

Pirates of the Caribbean PocketModel Game

boardgame.name: Petra, Paul & Co.
boardgame.description:
Petra, Paul & Co. is an educational game about decisions made in the local politics to improve your home town.

The Players act as local parties and try to get enough influence from the other players to fulfill their agendas.
If an agenda is fulfilled, the corresponding part of the gaming board is flipped over to show the improvement. The game ends if a player has fulfilled all of his agendas.

In their turn the players move on the board according to a die roll. They can change direction in 90 degrees but only once in their turn. If they get to another player or to a space that is connected to their agenda, they collect votes. if they get to the library or the newspaper, the players can answer a trivia question to collect another vote. The votes are collected on a separate board, witch shows the game progress. If a players stops at the town hall, a poll is executed. The wining agenda gets as many votes, as players take part.

The game is a clear educational game with easy mechanism for quick explanation.

boardgame.name: De Verbis
boardgame.description:
De Verbis is a promotional word-formation game from Linguamón - House of languages and it can be played in various languages. From the rules booklet:

"Only one thing is more fun than guessing words: getting others to do it. In DE VERBIS, players take turns at thinking up and guessing words. The player who does it best wins the round."


Contents:

45 letter cards
10 "?" cards
30 counters
A pen and paper are needed for keeping score


Summary of rules:
In each round one of the players thinks a 8-10 letter word and marks it with the "?" cards on the table and keeps the deck of letter cards. The other players are given some tokens and, in turn, they ask for a letter: if it is included in the word, the player with the deck of cards places that letter in its correct position on top of the corresponding "?" card; if the letter is not in the word, the player who asked for it must pay 1 token. Whenever a player guesses the word correctly he receives 2 tokens plus as many tokens as "?" cards are still in the word; but if the guessed word is wrong, the player must pay 2 tokens. The player who thought the word receives as many tokens as the difference between the top scorer and the least scorer.

Following the philosophy of the publisher the rules are in Catalan, Spanish, English, French, Basque, Galician, Occitan and Italian.

About the publisher:
The publisher, Linguamón – House of Languages, is a body set up by the Government of Catalonia with the aim of promoting the world's languages as a:

vehicle for communication, civilization and dialog
source of personal development, human creativity and heritage of mankind
right of individuals and of linguistic communities

boardgame.name: Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro
boardgame.description:
The second Master Set for the HeroScape series of games.

Many different battlefields can be built by attaching and stacking the tiles. Each unit in the Master Set has a movement rating which is the number of hexes it can move in a turn. Moving up a level counts as a hex; moving down does not incur that penalty. Moving down more levels than your height when moving from one hex to another counts as falling and you might take damage - unless you are falling into water.

Combat in the game is fairly straightforward. You roll attack dice as listed on your unit's card under attack, and the opponent rolls defense dice equal to the defense number on their unit's card. Skulls rolled in excess of shields count as wounds. When the number of wounds equals the unit's life value, it is killed and removed from the board.

The master game uses a point system in which players alternate drafting cards until they reach the pre-assigned point value for the scenario. It's possible to bring a "pre-fab" army to the battle in order to save time.

The game is eminently customizable, with many expansions which add more abilities, terrain, and options. There are also user-created maps, scenarios, custom units and advanced rules available online.

From the publisher:
For years the Marro have been summoned to Valhalla to expand the will of Utgar at all costs. But rumors are spreading that within the uncharted jungle there is an even greater menace waiting. A great Marro Hive, hidden deep within in the jungle swamps and treacherous rock is continuously spawning new savage predators. These creatures, said to be venomous Marro, perhaps even Hivelords, will emerge from their colony and contaminate the world. Includes 24 detailed miniature figures and 75 interlocking terrain pieces.

This new Master Set includes everything you need to start your own adventures in the Heroscape world of Valhalla! There are 2 new Terrain Types: Swamp & Swamp Water, as well as more Grass, Sand, Rock, and Water tiles to add to your existing Heroscape battlefields.

Also included in the set are 7 Unique Heroes, and 3 Common Marro Squads. However, the big news is the inclusion of the Marro Hive. The Hive has special powers directly relating to Common Marro Squad figures.

boardgame.name: Dirtside
boardgame.description:
DIRTSIDE is a D6 based rules system designed for playing out table-top miniatures actions simulating Armour and Infantry actions in a Science-Fiction setting, whether on Earth or other worlds.

It is a generic system allowing players to generate arms and armor from any setting they choose.

The rules are aimed primarily at 1/300 miniatures but can easily be used at any scale.

Rules cover Infantry, Armour, Artillery, Air Support and even Battle-walkers.

Some of the mechanisms include Multiphase turns, Overwatch, Line of Sight, ECM and Time-on-target.

This set of rules was followed up by the more detailed and better produced DIRTSIDE II rules (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/5687).

boardgame.name: Coin Hopping: Washington DC
boardgame.description:
From the press release:

Scatter some coins on the board and you are ready to play Coin Hopping-Washington DC, a game of strategy. Coin Hopping Washington DC is a board game with global appeal. International travelers with thoughts about visiting Washington DC will find this game as indispensable as their guide books. The game board, a beautiful map of the National Mall and surrounding areas, invites exploration of the city and its landmarks. Game includes fifty destination cards with pictures of things to see. It’s a patriotic experience all Americans will find engaging. Players vie to become President, appoint Supreme Court Justices, and they even vote in Congress to change the rules of the game! The game is fast paced and topical as all eyes turn toward the next US election year in 2008.

boardgame.name: Gridlock
boardgame.description:
From the press release:

This double-sided board game offers two games in one. In Gridlock Jr. Ages 5-10, players battle a huge traffic jam, directing traffic to get the police car to the crime scene and others where they need to be. Gridlock Sr. Ages 10 and up is more challenging, with vehicle breakdowns, time pressure, and no stop signs. “The special quality of this board game is that it is cooperative. All the players must work together to free up the traffic jam; otherwise, nobody will get anywhere. Sort of like real life!”

boardgame.name: Homogenius
boardgame.description:
From the press release:

Homogenius, the gay trivia board game, celebrates gay culture and explores the contributions that gay personalities have made to theater, music, movies, television, publishing and politics. The object of this board game, which comes packaged in a stylish trunk-like box, is to “come out of the closet” by correctly answering a series of gay trivia questions in two categories: Rumor and Potpourri. Players start “In the Closet” and whoever gets “Out of the Closet” first wins. The game includes 355 question cards, 6 game tokens, 1 die and a colorful game board.

boardgame.name: Roxy's Eat Right Board Game
boardgame.description:
Join Roxy and her friends on a quest to find healthy foods. The Roxy's Eat Right board game teaches children about the food groups, the food pyramid, calories, vitamins and minerals, how to make balanced meals, and how to identify junk foods. The box contains one fold-out 20" x 20" game sheet and 51 Eat Right Cards. The game sheet is 2-sided (2 games), plus there are rules for 2 other games to play with just the cards.

Each card highlights a common food item in beautifully colored graphics illustrated by former Disney cartoonist, Clifford Dunston.

• Each card shows the number of servings of the food group for which it pertains.

• Each card shows the typical number of calories in the food item.

• Each card has a "Vitamin Power" rating and a "Junk Factor" rating. These ratings are calculated using a formula based on the content of vitamins, minerals and junk ingredients (fat, cholesterol, added sugars and sodium) as a percentage of the Recommended Daily Allowance (RDA)

• Each card is given an "Overall Rating" based on a formula using Vitamin Power per Calorie and Junk Factor per Calorie.

• Each card has a short description of the good and bad characteristics of the food item.

• The cards are color-coded by food group acording to MyPyramid.

• Each deck comes with 3 different games: Duel, Snack Attack, and Build-A-Meal - find even more game rules here.

• Each of the games will help kids to form healthy eating habits. Players are rewarded for choosing good foods to eat and penalized for eating junk foods.

• Teachers can use these cards in the classroom as an fun teaching tool - kids just love the cards!
